meanings.definition: A printing process in which the printing surface is flat and the image is transferred to paper without the use of raised printing elements.
meanings.sent1: The planography of this book allowed for clear images on every page.
meanings.sent2: The artist used planography to create beautiful prints on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The planography of the map made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: Her planography skills transformed the blank canvas into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The planography process made the pictures look smooth and professional.

meanings.definition: The technique or process of creating images or designs on a flat surface for printing.
meanings.sent1: Learning planography helped me understand how to make prints.
meanings.sent2: The planography used in the magazine made the images pop.
meanings.sent3: His planography work turned the plain paper into a colorful canvas.
meanings.sent4: The planography process was like painting with ink on a flat surface.
meanings.sent5: The artist's planography technique brought the design to life on the page.
